definitions.definition: Not positioned upon, or away from a position upon.
examples: He's off the roof now.
I took it off the table.
Keep off the grass.

definitions.definition: Detached, separated, excluded or disconnected from; away from a position of attachment or connection to.
examples: The phone is off the hook
The coat fell off the peg.
He was thrown off the team for cheating.
We've been off the grid for three days now.
We're off their radar.
He's off the computer, but he's still on the phone.

definitions.definition: Outside the area or region of.
examples: The suspect is now believed to be off the campus.
I couldn't see what it said because the line of text ran off the page.

definitions.definition: Temporarily not attending (a usual place), especially owing to illness or holiday.
examples: off work; off school

definitions.definition: Used to indicate the location or direction of one thing relative to another, implying adjacency or accessibility via.
examples: His office is off this corridor on the right.
We're just off the main road.
Look! There's a UFO off our left wing!

subdefinitions.definition: Used to express location at sea relative to land or mainland.
examples: The island is 23 miles off the cape.
There's 20% off the list price.
He's been off his feed since Tuesday.
He's off his meds again.
He didn't buy it off him. He stole it off him.

definitions.definition: Placed after a number (of products or parts, as if a unit), in commerce or engineering .
examples: I'd like to re-order those printer cartridges, let's say 5- off .
The guy was off a perc.
The team won off a late-game fumble by an opposing player.
The economy is rising off the strength of the tech sector.

main_definition: Not positioned upon, or away from a position upon.
secondary_definitions: Detached, separated, excluded or disconnected from; away from a position of attachment or connection to.
Outside the area or region of.
Temporarily not attending (a usual place), especially owing to illness or holiday.
Used to indicate the location or direction of one thing relative to another, implying adjacency or accessibility via.
( colloquial , more properly 'from' ) Out of the possession of.
Placed after a number (of products or parts, as if a unit), in commerce or engineering .
( slang , drugs ) Under the influence of.
